business.headline: Credit card EMIs: Smart tool or hidden cost?Credit card EMIs have become a common way to manage big purchases, but are they truly a smart budgeting tool or just another expense disguised as convenience?

Good news on India–US trade deal once it's fair and equitable, says Piyush GoyalSpeaking at the Indo-US Economic Summit organised by the Indo-American Chamber of Commerce in New Delhi, Piyush Goyal said negotiations are moving ahead, but a final announcement will come only when the terms are acceptable and mutually beneficial.

What is the 9-9-6 work culture Narayana Murthy wants Indians to learn from?In his latest remarks, Murthy referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 working culture, a system followed by many Chinese tech companies during their rapid growth phase.

What your health insurer's high claim settlement ratio isn't telling youHealth insurance claim settlement ratios often look impressive but hide critical details about payouts, delays, and deductions. In this special report, we unpack what the number really means for policyholders.
Sensex ends 325 points lower, Nifty closes below 26,000; IT stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 324.96 points to close at 84,625.99, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 103.40 points to end at 25,910.05.
Fujiyama Power Systems IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusApplicants can now check whether they have received shares through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

Rs 5,000 SIP vs Rs 60,000 lump sum: Which creates more wealth in 10 years?Is it wiser to invest Rs 5,000 every month, or does a yearly Rs 60,000 lump sum genuinely create more wealth in the long run? We explore the answer here.
Excelsoft Technologies IPO Opens on November 19: Check GMP and price bandFounded in 2000, Excelsoft Technologies is known for its tech-led solutions in the education and assessment industry.

Why chasing every new IPO can hurt your portfolioChasing every new IPO may feel exciting, but it often does more harm than good. Many recent listings have slipped below their issue price, showing that hype doesn't always translate into real returns.

PhysicsWallah shares up 40% over IPO price: Should you sell or hold?The stock opened at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, giving investors a 33% premium over the issue price of Rs 109. This opening surprised market participants, as the GMP trend had pointed to only a mild gain ahead of the listing.

Has your tax refund been delayed? CBDT chief explains whyIf you're still waiting for your income-tax refund, you're not alone. The CBDT chief has clarified why some payouts are taking longer this year and what the department is doing to speed things up.

Digital gold firms knock on Sebi's door, seek regulatory supervision: ReportWith digital gold gaining traction across India, questions around safety and regulation are becoming louder. Industry bodies and platforms now want formal oversight to boost trust in the fast-growing segment.

PhysicsWallah makes strong market debut as shares list at 33% premiumPhysicsWallah share price: The stock listed at Rs 145 on the NSE and Rs 143.10 on the BSE, marking a sharp 33% premium over its issue price of Rs 109.

Narayana Murthy now cites Chinese 9-9-6 system to back 72-hour work week callIn a recent interview, the 79-year-old billionaire referred to China's well-known 9-9-6 work culture to support his long-held view that young Indians should work longer hours to help India grow faster.

Sensex, Nifty fall in early trade amid a cautious start on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 136 points to 84,814.95 around 9:34 am, while the Nifty50 fell 49.95 points to 25,963.50. Sectoral indices were mixed, reflecting the cautious tone among investors.

Why gold, silver prices are falling today and what to expect nextIn India, gold and silver prices also reflected this weakness. As of Tuesday morning, 24-karat gold was priced at Rs 12,343 per gram and Rs 1,23,430 per 10 grams.

PhysicsWallah IPO listing: GMP bounces back, but will investors actually gain?Despite the company's strong brand presence and loyal student base, its IPO received a modest subscription, suggesting that investor sentiment remains cautious.

You're applying for IPOs. But are you funding growth or just promoter exits?The IPO market looks hotter than ever, but the rise of OFS-led offerings reveals a trend most retail investors rarely pause to examine. In Part 2 of The Great IPO Gamble series, we break down what's changing beneath the hype.

US says sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil already cutting Russia's oil revenueThe US Treasury says sanctions on Russian oil majors are lowering revenues and sales. The two largest buyers of Russian oil have been China and India.

Is it possible to improve your credit score without owning a card?Many people assume that a credit card is essential for building a good credit score. But experts say that's not true. With the right financial habits and timely repayments, you can strengthen your credit profile even without owning a card.

entertainment.headline: Andhra King Taluka trailer: Ram Pothineni leads an emotional fan-idol saga The much-anticipated trailer of 'Andhra King Taluka', starring Ram Pothineni, Bhagyashri Borse, and Upendra, was launched at a public event in Kurnool. The film will hit theatres on November 27.

Jaya Bachchan, Waheeda Rehman attend Kamini Kaushal's prayer meet The film community gathered to pay respects to Kamini Kaushal during a peaceful prayer meet. It was attended by Jaya Bachchan and Waheeda Rehman, among others.

Ryan Gosling's space thriller Project Hail Mary gets India release date Project Hail Mary, based on Andy Weir's novel, will arrive in Indian cinemas in 2026, featuring Ryan Gosling as a lone astronaut on a mission to save Earth. The film will have screenings in English, Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu.

Veteran South actor Tulasi announces retirement on Instagram Veteran South Indian actor Tulasi has announced her retirement from films, marking the end of a remarkable career spanning nearly six decades. She shared her decision through heartfelt spiritual posts on Instagram, expressing gratitude and a peaceful continuation of her journey.

Bollywood's new prodigy: Ranveer compares Dhurandhar's Sara Arjun to Dakota Fanning Ranveer Singh spoke highly of his young co-star Sara Arjun during the launch event for Aditya Dhar's film 'Dhurandhar'. He highlighted her talent and experience ahead of the movie's December release.

The chameleon is back: Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar trailer wows Deepika Padukone Deepika Padukone joined fans in praising Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' trailer as social media buzz intensified. She commented on his trailer post on Instagram and praised his acting skills.

Priyanka Chopra enjoys a quiet Goa break after Varanasi event in Hyderabad. Pics Priyanka Chopra enjoyed a short break in Goa after the high-octane 'Varanasi' event in Hyderabad. She shared moments of her stay and expressed her fondness for the city on Instagram.

Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar director Aditya Dhar praises team for 16-18 hour shifts Aditya Dhar praised the 'Dhurandhar' team for working 16-18 hours daily during the shoot. The trailer launch highlighted the film's intense action and the crew's dedication amid industry debates on work hours.

BLACKPINK's Jisoo talks perfect love and moving on from Ahn Bo Hyun split Singer Jisoo shares her perspectives on love and self-care after ending her public relationship, while preparing for BLACKPINK's upcoming music and ongoing world tour.

Co-Ed trailer: Rajeshwari, Varun star in drama about a school in midst of chaos The trailer for the upcoming Amazon MX Player series 'Co-Ed', starring Rajeshwari Sachdev, Varun Badola, Vedant Sinha and Adrija Sinha, has been released. It offers a look at the merging of two Udaipur schools and the ensuing drama.

Complaint against SS Rajamouli over Lord Hanuman remarks at Varanasi event Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's remark about Lord Hanuman at the title launch of his new film have sparked debate and concern, with several groups calling for action in response to his comments. A police complaint has been filed against him in Hyderabad.
Dinesh Vijan announces seven new horror-comedies after Stree 2, Thamma Dinesh Vijan announces major expansion of Maddock Films' horror-comedy slate, outlines technology's impact on filmmaking.

Penn Badgley says he and wife Domino Kirke nearly divorced after 2 miscarriages Actor Penn Badgley shares how successive miscarriages nearly led to separation from his wife, Domino Kirke, and reflects on their experience of isolation, eventual family growth, and the need for greater openness about pregnancy loss.

Delhi Crime 3 director clarifies why Richie Mehta's name is still on the credits In an exclusive interview with India Today, 'Delhi Crime 3' director spoke about why the show's creator, Richie Mehta's name is still there on the credits.

After The Hunt Trailer: Julia Roberts, Andrew Garfield walk into a moral minefield Director Luca Guadagnino and actor Julia Roberts will receive the Gotham Awards Visionary Tribute, while their film After The Hunt is set for global streaming debut.

When Manoj Bajpayee locked himself in washroom to avoid meeting Amitabh Bachchan Manoj Bajpayee revisits his first meeting with Amitabh Bachchan during 'Satya' screening. The actor shares an emotional encounter and a special hug on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'.

Internet reacts to Dhurandhar trailer: Dear CBFC, don't mess up this time The trailer for the upcoming film 'Dhurandhar', headlined by Ranveer Singh, has sparked a flurry of reactions on social media. With its depiction of intense violence, users are both praising the film's style and expressing concern over its content.

120 Bahadur director Razneesh Ghai details film's intense 6-year prep In an exclusive interview with India Today, director Raneesh Ghai opened up about the massive effort behind bringing one of the world's most defining battles to screen with the upcoming film '120 Bahadur.'

How The Running Man Glen Powell just missed the bus to Hollywood top lot. For now Actor Glen Powell's Hollywood ascent hits a new roadblock as his new film, 'The Running Man', loses to 'Now You See Me' in the box office race, and earns mixed reviews, raising questions about his project choices

general news.headline: Saudi Arabia will get F-35s like Israel under new arrangement, Trump announcesTrump made the remarks in the Oval Office as he sat beside Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. The US President was asked how the administration planned to uphold Israel's advantage while approving Riyadh's request for the same fifth-generation aircraft.

ED arrests Al Falah founder, probing link to Red Fort blast terror fundingThe probe began after FIRs accusing the university of fake NAAC accreditation and misleading UGC claims. The ED is also examining whether any laundered funds were used to support those involved in the November 10 Red Fort blast, which killed 14 people.

200 Indians deported from US: Anmol Bishnoi, two Punjab wanted on flightThe United States has deported 200 Indian nationals, including notorious gangster Anmol Bishnoi, back to India. This significant move marks a crucial step in India's fight against organised crime and fugitive criminals abroad.

No question of sacking Gautam Gambhir, India need better pitches: Sourav GangulySourav Ganguly has dismissed calls to sack Gautam Gambhir after India's Eden Gardens defeat. He believes better pitches, patience and clearer planning are the real priorities as India look to correct recurring Test-match flaws.
MBS gets royal welcome as Saudi prince arrives at White House for Trump meet

This is revenge, not justice: Sheikh Hasina's son Sajeeb Wazed on death verdictWazed accused the interim administration of selective justice, claiming killings of police personnel and Awami League workers during the 2024 student uprising had been given indemnity.

2 suicides, protests in 3 states: Why booth officials are feeling SIR heatSIR exercise: Across the states, there is one common refrain from the booth-level officers or BLOs - work pressure, long hours, and unrealistic targets that have pushed them to the breaking point.

Who is Anmol Bishnoi, gangster tied to murders of Baba Siddique and Moose Wala?Indian security agencies have exposed a sprawling international financial network run by the Bishnoi crime syndicate, with Anmol Bishnoi playing a pivotal role in its overseas dealings. His recent deportation to India marks a major step in cracking down on the gang's global operations.

Raulane, the 5,000-year-old Himachal festival that even history can't explainRaulane, a 5,000-year-old festival from Himachal Pradesh, blends mountain folklore, community rituals, and ancient Himalayan beliefs into a living tradition that survives without written history, carrying a cultural memory older than civilisation.

A Pakistani CM just exposed Pakistan govt's terror policyKhyber Pakhtunkhwa Chief Minister Sohail Afridi has accused Islamabad of staging terror attacks and sabotaging peace efforts in the province. His statement has come amid a surge in violence in the volatile tribal province bordering Afghanistan.

Zohran Mamdani hates Indians: Trump Junior's charge against New York Mayor-electEric Trump's assertion that Mamdani "hates the Indian population" is part of a wider Republican effort to portray the mayor-elect as a radical socialist, with critics warning that his policies could threaten the city's stability.

H-1B petitions by Indian companies fall, Amazon, Meta top 2025 listH-1B visa petitions by Indian companies in FY 2025 dropped by 37% compared to last year's numbers. The drop is a significant 70% compared to a decade ago. US tech giants, Amazon, Meta, Microsoft, and Google, dominated new H-1B approvals.

Javed Akhtar was in tears after watching 120 Bahadur, reveals Farhan AkhtarFarhan Akhtar revealed his father Javed Akhtar was deeply moved by '120 Bahadur'. The film is based on the Battle of Rezang La and is set to release on November 21.

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Bihar Speaker's post settled, JD(U) adamant on retaining Home: SourcesThe main contention is over the Home Department, which Nitish Kumar has held so far. Earlier, sources said both the JDU and BJP were eyeing the Speaker's post, with the BJP keen to retain it. However, allies now show no disagreement over the Speaker's position.

Forget politics, I'll leave Bihar: Smarting, Prashant Kishor dares JD(U) againPrashant Kishor said he would "definitely quit politics" if the Nitish Kumar-led NDA government fulfils its poll promise of giving Rs 2 lakh each to 1.5 crore women. Rejecting claims that he plans to exit after Jan Suraaj's defeat, Kishor said he will stay in Bihar and intensify his campaign.

Why modern marriages need maintenance, not expiry datesThe latest debate taking over the internet is whether marriages should come with an expiry and renewal date — all thanks to Kajol and Twinkle Khanna's show 'Two Much'.

Congress allies with Jamaat, Vijayan welcomes Hamas: BJP leader after Delhi blastFormer Union Minister and senior BJP leader Rajeev Chandrashekhar slammed the INDIA bloc, pointing to what he described as the Congress party's "open alliance" with Jamaat-e-Islami in Kerala and Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's "welcome" of Hamas.

India rolls out next-gen e-passports: A look at key security upgradesIndia is rolling out next-generation e-passports with advanced security features and RFID chips under the upgraded Passport Seva Programme 2.0.

Why Trump is gifting F-35 jets to Saudi ArabiaDonald Trump surprised one and all by announcing that he would approve the sale of F-35 jets to Saudi Arabia. So far, Israel is the only country in the Middle East to have the jet. What's behind Trump's move?

Irony dies twice as Jamaat cheers Hasina's BhasmasuraA double irony unfolded as the International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) of Bangladesh gave ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina the death sentence. The ICT was set up by Hasina herself to try those accused of 1971 war crimes. The Jamaat-e-Islami, which lauded the ICT verdict, had the most number of leaders hanged by the tribunal.

Suicide bombing very misunderstood, says Red Fort bomber in unseen videoIn the unseen footage, the Red Fort bomber talks about the "misunderstood" concept of suicide bombing. He explains that what is often labelled as a suicide bombing is actually a martyrdom operation in Islam.

Behind top Maoist Hidma's killing, a story of split, betrayal and dogged huntMadvi Hidma's death in a counter-insurgency operation signals the near-collapse of the Maoist insurgency in India. Hidma, one of the top Maoist commanders, hid from security forces even as he masterminded brutal killings. A split among Maoists and the back-to-back operations against Left-Wing Extremism is what got him killed.

NEP and the 86-million question: Can India hit 50% gross enrollment by 2035?A large number of Indians today are still unable to access higher education and remain outside our institutions. The latest reports suggest that to meet the NEP 2020 target, India must reach a 50% enrolment rate by 2035, which means adding nearly 86 million new students. This is a steep climb. Many challenges already exist, and addressing them will require a major shift in how the system works.

Andhra King Taluka trailer: Ram Pothineni leads an emotional fan-idol sagaThe much-anticipated trailer of 'Andhra King Taluka', starring Ram Pothineni, Bhagyashri Borse, and Upendra, was launched at a public event in Kurnool. The film will hit theatres on November 27.

Jaya Bachchan, Waheeda Rehman attend Kamini Kaushal's prayer meetThe film community gathered to pay respects to Kamini Kaushal during a peaceful prayer meet. It was attended by Jaya Bachchan and Waheeda Rehman, among others.

sports.headline: India A cruise to Asia Cup semis despite rare off day for Vaibhav Suryavanshi India A bounced back strongly after their loss to Pakistan A, easing past Oman A to reach the Asia Cup semifinals. Harsh Dubey's composed fifty and a disciplined bowling effort ensured a confident, much-needed turnaround for the squad.

India's football dream screams after embarrassing 0-1 loss to Bangladesh India's 0–1 defeat to Bangladesh capped a tough night that summed up a wider footballing crisis. With the ISL's future uncertain and the national team bottom of their group, India's football dream feels increasingly shaky.

No question of sacking Gautam Gambhir, India need better pitches: Sourav Ganguly Sourav Ganguly has dismissed calls to sack Gautam Gambhir after India's Eden Gardens defeat. He believes better pitches, patience and clearer planning are the real priorities as India look to correct recurring Test-match flaws.

India need to change their mindset after Kolkata Test loss: Sourav Ganguly IND vs SA: India need a mindset shift after their Kolkata Test defeat, says Sourav Ganguly, who admits the Eden pitch "was not the greatest" and insists India must play on better surfaces despite their request for a turning track.

Nervous Pakistan survive Zimbabwe scare to make winning start in tri-series PAK vs ZIM: Pakistan survived a major scare to chase down 148 and beat Zimbabwe by five wickets in the opening match of the tri-series, thanks to Usman Khan's unbeaten 37 and Mohammad Nawaz's late heroics.

Kolkata loss no worry; no one questioned our wins on turning tracks: Bhuvneshwar Bhuvneshwar Kumar feels that India's loss in the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens in Kolkata is nothing to worry about. He also snapped back at the pitch critics, saying that it was never questioned when India were winning.

Back to original form: Babar Azam trolled after 0 vs Zimbabwe in Pakistan tri-series PAK vs ZIM: Babar Azam was dismissed for a duck in the T20 tri-series opener against Zimbabwe at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium. The dismissal sparked intense criticism and increased pressure on Pakistan's star batter.

Gavaskar quotes Ben Stokes to slam Indian pitch critics: Haranguing predictable India's defeat at Eden Gardens has reignited the pitch debate, but Sunil Gavaskar insists the criticism is misplaced. He says India must fix its batting approach instead of blaming turning tracks.

Bangladesh captain slammed for 'Am I Harmanpreet Kaur' remark: In your dreams Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty faced backlash after criticising Indian World Cup-winning captain Harmanpreet Kaur while denying allegations of mistreating junior players. Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy two years ago.

MS Dhoni still on-field captain of CSK, Ruturaj just on paper: Mohammad Kaif Mohammad Kaif believes MS Dhoni will continue as Chennai Super Kings' central leader in IPL 2026, playing a crucial mentoring and guiding role on the field, even though Ruturaj Gaikwad is the official captain.

Saif Hassan named Bangladesh T20I vice-captain, Litton Das captain until T20 World Cup Saif Hassan has been promoted to Bangladesh's T20I vice-captaincy following impressive performances this year, while Litton Das remains T20I captain ahead of the 2026 World Cup to be held next year.

Back to original form: Babar Azam trolled after 0 vs Zimbabwe in Pakistan tri-series PAK vs ZIM: Babar Azam was dismissed for a duck in the T20 tri-series opener against Zimbabwe at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium. The dismissal sparked intense criticism and increased pressure on Pakistan's star batter.

Gavaskar quotes Ben Stokes to slam Indian pitch critics: Haranguing predictable India's defeat at Eden Gardens has reignited the pitch debate, but Sunil Gavaskar insists the criticism is misplaced. He says India must fix its batting approach instead of blaming turning tracks.

Bangladesh captain slammed for 'Am I Harmanpreet Kaur' remark: In your dreams Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty faced backlash after criticising Indian World Cup-winning captain Harmanpreet Kaur while denying allegations of mistreating junior players. Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy two years ago.

MS Dhoni still on-field captain of CSK, Ruturaj just on paper: Mohammad Kaif Mohammad Kaif believes MS Dhoni will continue as Chennai Super Kings' central leader in IPL 2026, playing a crucial mentoring and guiding role on the field, even though Ruturaj Gaikwad is the official captain.

Saif Hassan named Bangladesh T20I vice-captain, Litton Das captain until T20 World Cup Saif Hassan has been promoted to Bangladesh's T20I vice-captaincy following impressive performances this year, while Litton Das remains T20I captain ahead of the 2026 World Cup to be held next year.

India bring in ambidextrous spinner to deal with South Africa spin threat in GuwahatiIND vs SA: India roped in ambidextrous Bengal spinner Kaushik Maity for specialised match-simulation training to help their batters prepare for South Africa's potent spin attack ahead of the second Test in Guwahati.

Karim Benzema comes in support of Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr: He's phenomenalKarim Benzema has come to the defence of Vinicius Jr amid rising criticism in Spain. The former Real Madrid striker believes the Brazilian is being judged too harshly and still has the potential to reach even greater heights.

Saina Nehwal and Peter Gade reunite in Delhi to inspire badminton's next generationBadminton icons Saina Nehwal and Peter Gade will headline the Legends' Vision – Legacy Tour India as the initiative returns to Delhi after eight years. The two-day event brings legends, juniors and fans together, highlighted by a racquet donation drive aimed at widening access to the sport.

Manu Bhaker after ISSF World Championships failure: You can't win everydayManu Bhaker reflected on her medal-less World Championships campaign, praising Esha Singh's bronze while acknowledging her own dip in form and stressing that setbacks are part of sport.

Even Tendulkar or Kohli won't survive on current Indian pitches: Harbhajan SinghFormer India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has slammed Indian pitches, saying that batting stalwarts like Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli wouldn't be able to survive on such surfaces.

Kolkata Test star says Temba Bavuma didn't get what he deserved after heroic knockIND vs SA, 1st Test: South Africa off-spinner Simon Harmer believes captain Temba Bavuma deserved Player of the Match in the first Test against India. Bavuma's gritty fifty and a key catch were pivotal in South Africa's historic win in Kolkata.

James Anderson's Ashes wake-up call: Not just pace, England need to be relentlessJames Anderson advises England's fast bowlers to combine pace with accuracy for Ashes success. He highlights Ben Stokes' role and warns that relentlessness, not just speed, will decide the series outcome.

Manu Bhaker after ISSF World Championships failure: You can't win everydayManu Bhaker reflected on her medal-less World Championships campaign, praising Esha Singh's bronze while acknowledging her own dip in form and stressing that setbacks are part of sport.

Even Tendulkar or Kohli won't survive on current Indian pitches: Harbhajan SinghFormer India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has slammed Indian pitches, saying that batting stalwarts like Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli wouldn't be able to survive on such surfaces.

Kolkata Test star says Temba Bavuma didn't get what he deserved after heroic knockIND vs SA, 1st Test: South Africa off-spinner Simon Harmer believes captain Temba Bavuma deserved Player of the Match in the first Test against India. Bavuma's gritty fifty and a key catch were pivotal in South Africa's historic win in Kolkata.

James Anderson's Ashes wake-up call: Not just pace, England need to be relentlessJames Anderson advises England's fast bowlers to combine pace with accuracy for Ashes success. He highlights Ben Stokes' role and warns that relentlessness, not just speed, will decide the series outcome.

Marnus Labuschagne fires warning to England bowlers ft Jofra Archer ahead of AshesAustralia's Marnus Labuschagne has issued a sharp warning to England's fast bowlers ahead of the Ashes. With Jofra Archer back in the mix, the Australian batter believes he's in his best form since their dramatic 2019 duel.

Bangladesh Women's tour of India postponed amid political tensions: ReportsBangladesh's women's cricket tour of India has been postponed, with both boards citing scheduling pressures amid heightened political tensions. The two teams were scheduled to play three ODIs and three T20Is in December.

Babar Azam breaks silence to ex-Pakistan captain on pain of personal attacksFormer Pakistan captain Ramiz Raja lifted the lid on a private conversation with Babar Azam, saying the superstar batter expressed his frustration over personal attacks. Babar ended an 807-day wait for an international hundred earlier this month.

Heartbroken Carlos Alcaraz pulls out of Davis Cup due to hamstring injuryCarlos Alcaraz withdrew from the Davis Cup Finals with a hamstring injury but still finished the season as the year-end world No.1 after a consistently dominant 2025 campaign.

Jason Gillespie on Kolkata Test row: Hosts must stay out of pitch preparationJason Gillespie has urged for full freedom for cricket pitch curators without host nation influence. The Kolkata pitch came under the scanner after India's loss against South Africa inside three days.

Tuchel plans talks with sidelined players over England recall before World CupThomas Tuchel will meet with omitted England players to clarify selection choices ahead of the 2026 FIFA World Cup. England remain unbeaten and without conceding in Group K, as Tuchel prepares for another training camp before final squad decisions.

PAK vs SL: Babar Azam reprimanded by ICC after striking the stumps in 3rd ODIBabar Azam has been fined and given a demerit point for breaching the ICC Code of Conduct during the third ODI against Sri Lanka. The Pakistan star struck the stumps after his dismissal but accepted the penalty. The sanction comes despite his strong batting performance in the series.

IND vs SA: Nitish Reddy joins team in Guwahati as cover for injured Shubman GillIndia all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been added as a cover to the squad for the injured captain Shubman Gill ahead of the second Test against South Africa in Guwahati.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
